alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 4:03PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water on the Tanana River and Tributaries Draining the Alaska Range into Next Week... High water on the Tanana River and tributaries draining the Alaska Range will continue into next week. This includes the Chisana River, Nabesna River, Gerstle River, Delta River, and the Nenana River. The Tanana River is running at bankfull with minor flooding possible in low lying area over the several days. Heavy rain over the Alaska Range the past week has caused high water on these rivers. Another 0.50 inch to 1.00 inch of rain fell over much of the Alaska Range Friday into Saturday morning. This water is now draining into these already high rivers, and could cause minor flooding over the next several days. A Flood Advisory is in effect through Noon Monday from Delta Junction to Old Minto, including Fairbanks and Nenana. A Flood Watch is in affect through Monday for the Tanana River from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs. Please see those products for more details. In addition to the high water, many areas east of Delta Junction could have frost early Sunday.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
